revised_title: Developmental History and Unique Larval Stages of Mutela bourguignati
tldr: The article provides a detailed account of the development and unique larval stages of Mutela bourguignati, an African freshwater bivalve. The study reveals that the eggs develop into a free-living larva that later transforms into a parasitic phase, attaching itself to a specific fish species. The article emphasizes the importance of considering larval development in the classification of these organisms.
